alert.note: Alert for Barron; Polk (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 12:08PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Barron and southeastern Polk Counties through 1245 PM CDT... At 1208 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Clayton, or 25 miles southwest of Rice Lake, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Turtle Lake around 1215 PM CDT. Almena around 1225 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Barron and Cameron. This includes U.S. Highway 53 between mile markers 130 and 140. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
